item.title: Kelly add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Maybe this world is another planet’s hell." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "At the temple there is a poem called "Loss" carved into the stone. It has three words, but the poet has scratched them out. You cannot read loss, only feel it." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: Kelly add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I always deserve the best treatment because I never put up with any other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I— I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Kelly add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Don't Panic." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "This must be Thursday,' said Arthur to himself, sinking low over his beer. 'I never could get the hang of Thursdays." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Ford... you're turning into a penguin. Stop it." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I think you ought to know I'm feeling very depressed." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "If I ever meet myself,' said Zaphod, 'I'll hit myself so hard I won't know what's hit me." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "And so the Universe ended." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "All you need is love. But a little chocolate now and then doesn't hurt." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description:
"Just believe everything I tell you, and it will all be very, very simple.'
Ah, well, I'm not sure I believe that." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Space is big. You just won't believe how vastly, hugely, mind-bogglingly big it is. I mean, you may think it's a long way down the road to the chemist's, but that's just peanuts to space." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "What to do if you find yourself stuck in a crack in the ground underneath a giant boulder you can't move, with no hope of rescue. Consider how lucky you are that life has been good to you so far. Alternatively, if life hasn't been good to you so far, which given your current circumstances seems more likely, consider how lucky you are that it won't be troubling you much longer." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Kelly add a quote by Katherine Paterson
item.description: "Reading can be a road to freedom or a key to a secret garden, which, if tended, will transform all of life." -- Katherine Paterson

item.title: Kelly add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I will not say, do not weep, for not all tears are an evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kelly add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
